pyfemtet.opt.opt package

Module contents

class pyfemtet.opt.opt.AbstractOptimizer[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for an interface of optimization library.

fem

The finite element method object.

Type:

FEMInterface

fem_class

The class of the finite element method object.

Type:

type

fem_kwargs

The keyword arguments used to instantiate the finite element method object.

Type:

dict

parameters

The parameters used in the optimization.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

objectives

A dictionary containing the objective functions used in the optimization.

Type:

dict

constraints

A dictionary containing the constraint functions used in the optimization.

Type:

dict

entire_status

The status of the entire optimization process.

Type:

OptimizationStatus

history

An actor object that records the history of each iteration in the optimization process.

Type:

History

worker_status

The status of each worker in a distributed computing environment.

Type:

OptimizationStatus

message

A message associated with the current state of the optimization process.

Type:

str

seed

The random seed used for random number generation during the optimization process.

Type:

int or None

timeout

The maximum time allowed for each iteration of the optimization process. If exceeded, it will be interrupted and terminated early.

Type:

float or int or None

n_trials

The maximum number of trials allowed for each iteration of the optimization process. If exceeded, it will be interrupted and terminated early.

Type:

int or None

is_cluster

Flag indicating if running on a distributed computing cluster.

Type:

bool

f(x)[source]

Get x, update fem analysis, return objectives (and constraints).

get_parameter(format='dict')[source]

Returns the parameters in the specified format.

Parameters:

format (str, optional) – The desired format of the parameters. Can be ‘df’ (DataFrame), ‘value’ (alias of values), ‘values’ (np.ndarray), or ‘dict’. Defaults to ‘dict’.

Returns:

The parameters in the specified format.

Return type:

object

Raises:

ValueError – If an invalid format is provided.

abstract run() → None[source]

Start calculation using optimization library.

set_parameter(params: dict) → None[source]

Update parameter.

Parameters:

params (dict) – Key is the name of parameter and the value is the value of it. The partial set is available.

set_parameter_values(values: ndarray) → None[source]

Update parameter with values.

Parameters:

values (np.ndarray) – Values of all parameters.

class pyfemtet.opt.opt.OptunaOptimizer(sampler_class: BaseSampler = None, sampler_kwargs: dict = None, add_init_method: str = None)[source]

Bases: AbstractOptimizer

add_init_parameter(parameter: dict, name: str = None)[source]

Add additional initial parameter for evaluate.

The parameter set is ignored if the main() is continued.

Parameters:

  • parameter (dict or Iterable) – Parameter to evaluate before run optimization algorithm.

  • name (str or None) – Optional. If specified, the name is saved in the history row. Default to None.

run()[source]

Set random seed, sampler, study and run study.optimize().
